channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: The Biden administration unveiled a plan to mandate the removal of nearly all nicotine from cigarettes, a plan that would upend the $95 billion U.S. cigarette industry and, health officials say, prompt millions of people to quit smoking https://t.co/j95kQwFE9X

Ernst & Young's plan to split its audit and consulting businesses would give thousands of its partners multimillion-dollar payouts and relies on optimistic growth assumptions to justify the deal, according to company documents and people familiar https://t.co/OVIn1lQAgS
The Supreme Court ruled religious schools can’t be excluded from a Maine program that pays private-school tuition for students in areas lacking public schools https://t.co/6aWEQZcB12
The classroom door in the Uvalde shooting wasn't locked and officers at the scene had nothing barring them from entering, Texas' chief of public safety said https://t.co/Q5qRevuIi9
Home prices hit a record median of $407,600 in May. Sales slipped as mortgage rates soared. https://t.co/XKff4RWHjU

South Korea joined an elite group of countries by placing a large satellite into orbit, harnessing technology that could be used to monitor and track North Korea’s military activity https://t.co/lbgPbp9JZE
Kellogg said it plans to split into three publicly traded companies, prompting a surge in its shares in premarket trading https://t.co/uIYGSHA1ht
The school year is done. Many teachers say they are done, too. https://t.co/GPh4CNvDEq
"I feel responsible for what my country is doing," said Dmitry Muratov editor-in-chief of the Russian Novaya Gazeta newspaper https://t.co/5dzwarQXhj
A group of American renewable-energy developers is making a $6 billion offer to solar manufacturers: Build panels in the U.S. and we will buy them https://t.co/HJusRikTGz
Bills to ban semiautomatic weapons like AR-15 style rifles haven’t come close to passing since the federal ban expired in 2004. https://t.co/gPyimpSlPc

South Korea joined an elite group of countries by successfully launching a large satellite into orbit, harnessing technology that could be used to monitor and track North Korea’s military activity #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/sYPKU2laNM https://t.co/xRbDsY9ZZE
A surgeon lost his life savings. Others have given up on their dreams. All of them were swept up in crypto mania—and the crash. https://t.co/ephP7kZ2Mm
Canada on Monday pledged to spend over $30 billion over the next two decades to help detect and track military threats from Russia and China in the Arctic https://t.co/C7wwvBqA2D
“Inflation doesn’t matter as much if you don’t spend money.” Meet the super-frugal families fighting inflation by curbing spending. https://t.co/4Hot9tI80f
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/ZAbwvxmHDg
Congratulations, you've hired someone to fill that open job. Next challenge is to get that person to actually show up. https://t.co/PLrfOZyvQf

The loss of French President Emmanuel Macron’s parliamentary majority is an early sign of how Russia’s squeeze on European energy prices is raising the economic and political stakes for European leaders https://t.co/R1csLZch0J

Medicare’s prescription-drug program could save billions of dollars annually if it purchased generic acid-reflux, cancer and other drugs from a new pharmacy backed by Mark Cuban, Harvard researchers say https://t.co/u3gQi6WVZm
Financial firm ProShares is set to roll out the first U.S.-listed ETF to bet against bitcoin https://t.co/bGh1QrE82h
The school year is done. Many teachers say they are done, too. https://t.co/yjPo6Utm0L
Swimming’s global governing body, FINA, barred almost all transgender women from competing in the women’s category in international events https://t.co/nxmeZTtLCe
Several SpaceX employees who were involved in a letter critical of Chief Executive Elon Musk and the way the company applies internal rules were fired https://t.co/rCHpGCTyka
Economists are now putting the probability of recession at a level usually seen only on the brink of or during recessions https://t.co/aF6j5jRFtQ
Apple employees at a retail store outside of Baltimore voted to unionize on Saturday. The move creates the first union of Apple retail employees in the U.S. https://t.co/JmjIzxPCob
Kate Bush’s surprising chart climb is the latest example of an old song from pop music’s library getting a new lease on life in the streaming era. https://t.co/TcrMeru7wJ
British golfer Matt Fitzpatrick won the U.S. Open, his first major title. https://t.co/ioeZxoQeU4
Hot-sauce lovers are going to be in for a rude awakening: A sriracha shortage is coming. https://t.co/4H0KAHDiUH
Gustavo Petro, a former leftist guerrilla, was elected president of Colombia after pledging to expand state control of the country’s economy to battle inequality and poverty. https://t.co/q6xrbmic7G

Democratic insiders expect Biden to run for re-election and appear to have little appetite for casting him aside, though they expressed concerns about his advanced age and low poll numbers https://t.co/SP4xpwjDjQ
French President Emmanuel Macron lost his majority in parliament, projections show, a blow to his pro-business agenda https://t.co/gJ6EaveLWk
Treasury Secretary Yellen said it's "worth considering" a temporary gasoline-tax holiday to ease the burden of high fuel prices https://t.co/n1ufopWjhP
Ukraine stepped up artillery and missile strikes against the Russian-controlled parts of the Donbas region, targeting weapons depots and military bases https://t.co/ealGW0vEiu
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal climbed by 45% last year. Here's what to know about why so many Americans are making the country their home base. https://t.co/ZmZqDnRvgh
Germany will restart coal-fired power plants and offer incentives for companies to use less natural gas after Russia moved to cut gas flows to Europe https://t.co/Wm3QpIG60b
For the first time, scientists have identified the entire genetic makeup of a victim of the deadly Mount Vesuvius eruption nearly 2,000 years ago https://t.co/KpQstWUQlD
Apple employees at a retail store outside of Baltimore voted to unionize https://t.co/S9ADnPMMUN
Imagine how boring food was in the 19th century, when garlic was absent from American cuisine. https://t.co/9OmJLYoxWs
Our reporter drove from New Orleans to Chicago and back to test the feasibility of taking a road trip in an EV. She wouldn’t do it again soon. https://t.co/Y4l0sF5G6B
R.I.P., Internet Explorer https://t.co/uWjJXjLyTb

From @WSJopinion: President Biden has suddenly discovered that a refinery shortage is driving up fuel prices. He’s blaming refiners, even as he doubles down on the policies that created the shortage. https://t.co/mIReO5be0a
Three years ago, Anna Weyant’s drawings were selling for $400 on the beach. Now the 27-year-old is an art star whose paintings sold for nearly $4 million combined at auction. https://t.co/sNnJ0sbRYq
A surgeon lost his life savings. Others have given up on their dreams. All of them were swept up in crypto mania—and the crash. https://t.co/UlWHlckCaV

Google suspended an engineer who contended that an artificial-intelligence chatbot the company developed had become sentient, telling him that he had violated the company’s confidentiality policy after it dismissed his claims. https://t.co/C5CnmBhLZh
Hot-sauce lovers are going to be in for a rude awakening: A sriracha shortage is coming. https://t.co/GI0ioYrYbJ
Walmart is the latest retailer to say it’s no longer carrying MyPillow products in stores. The retailer said the products will remain available online. https://t.co/a9rGj7D9vn
Here is an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal's weekend edition https://t.co/n7PVVkcM4R https://t.co/B3XWK7asDa
More than 60% of CEOs see a recession coming in the next 12 to 18 months, and some think one is already here, according to a survey released Friday by the Conference Board https://t.co/VKaWJbZBCf
President Biden took a fall Saturday when dismounting from his bicycle to talk to a small crowd near his vacation home in Delaware. He said he wasn’t injured. https://t.co/Ugfj0qIS78

TikTok said on Friday traffic for all U.S. user data is now being routed through the cloud infrastructure of its partner Oracle, a milestone in its latest attempt to respond to concerns about the security of data for its U.S. users https://t.co/Z0UzWkfx5q
